intro: Anotis affinis, commonly known as the narrow-leaved wallaby tree, is a species of flowering plant native to eastern Australia. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, often found in coastal and sandy soils. Its flowers, which are usually pale yellow or greenish, attract nectar-feeding birds and insects. The plant is also valued for its hardy nature and ability to thrive in various environmental conditions.
